Title: "The Deceiver" by John Lescroart

In "The Deceiver," the main character, Sam, is a disillusioned lawyer who crosses ethical boundaries when he becomes embroiled in a complex web of deception and fraud. Sam's plan involves impersonating a recently deceased client to access his estate, but the scheme soon spirals out of control as he is ensnared in a dangerous game of cat and mouse with a relentless detective.

As Sam's deception deepens, he finds himself fighting not just for his freedom, but for his life, as the lines between right and wrong, friend and foe, blur beyond recognition. This suspenseful crime novel explores the lengths people will go to for survival and the consequences of betraying one's own moral compass.

"The Deceiver" offers a gripping, character-driven story that delves into the darker aspects of human nature, and it should satisfy readers looking for a crime novel with a morally complex protagonist engaged in a thrilling and intricate scheme of deception.
